div.p:
Dr. Daniel Schafer
Department of History
University of North Florida30.270070 -81.508378
Jacksonville, Florida

James R. Ward, Staff Writer, The Florida Times-Union, P.O.
Box 1949, Jacksonville (32201) has generously donated the
enclosed letters from Mrs. James Weldon Johnson to him. These
are for the collection of black memorabilila at the University
of North Florida library30.270070 -81.508378. Please acknowledge to Mr. Ward.

Xeroxed copies of the enclosed have been given by Mr. Ward to
the Jackconville Historical Society for its use.

The correspondence with Mr. Ward was a result of his article
(or articles) in the paper (shorty before the August letter,
sorry I do not have exact date) about James Weldon Johnson and
the error in locating the marker erected in his memory. This
mistake was a natural one for amaturs to make for Lee Street
where the Johnsons lived was once Third Street. The marker was30.330144 -81.670309
placed on the preset Third Street, some miles away!

Enclosed:
1. Letter of August 21, 1972, Johnson to Ward, with two envelopes
2. Undated letter recieved September 26, 1972, Johnson to Ward.
3. Letter of tranmittal, September 26, 1972, from Jim Ward to me.

closer.signed:
Dena Snodgrass
CC: Miss Audry Broward, Archivist
Jacksonville Historical Society
